subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Jacksonville released receiver Jerry Porter and cornerback Drayton Florence, who were signed as high-priced free agents but failed to play up to expectations. Porter caught 11 passes for 181 yards and a touchdown after signing a six-year, $30 million contract that included $10 million guaranteed. Florence never won a starting job after signing a six-year, $36 million deal with $11 million guaranteed. The Jaguars were 5-11 last season.
